carbonReductionInitiatives.comment: The document explicitly mentions that Schindler has set a climate ambition to achieve net-zero GHG emissions by 2040, with medium-term 2030 goals aligned to the Paris Climate Agreement and validated by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi).

correctedData.comment: Schindler has set a climate ambition to achieve net-zero GHG emissions by 2040 and has integrated medium-term 2030 goals in its climate transition plan. These targets are aligned with the Paris Climate Agreement and validated by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi).

humanRightsLegalProceedings.comment: The document explicitly mentions that Schindler is not aware of any instances of forced labor in its own operations or in its supply chain, indicating that there are no human rights-related legal proceedings.

correctedData.comment: The relevant document explicitly mentions that the child labor risk assessment did not show any reasonable suspicion of child labor, neither in Schindler's own operations nor in its supply chain, and no child labor investigations or legal proceedings were reported.

environmentalPolicy.comment: The document mentions that Schindler's major product lines undergo a strict life cycle assessment (LCA) in accordance with the ISO 14040:2006 standard and that the Group's overarching environmental management systems are certified according to ISO 14001. This indicates the existence of an environmental policy.

correctedData.comment: Schindler has integrated eco-design principles and life cycle assessments in its product design, and its environmental management systems are certified according to ISO 14001. The company also manages hazardous substances and has policies for suppliers regarding these substances.

humanRightsDueDiligencePolicy.comment: Schindler's Human Rights Policy, which entered into force in December 2022, aims to foster a culture of respect for human rights and to comply with relevant regulations in its entire business operations and value chain.
